description:
Nuclear war has devastated the planet, turning one fertile ground into a barren, inhospitable landscape on which mankind struggles desperately to stay alive. Society has collapsed and a fight for control wages between vicious dictators, super-powerful mutants, and biker gangs that terrorize the streets.

In a world so cruel and bleak, only the chosen one can restore civilization to its former self. Kenshiro - master of the Hokuto Shinken fighting technique; a martial art so awesomely brutal that only a single being can be entrusted with its full power!

(Source: Manga Entertainment)
synonyms: Seikimatsu Kyuseishu Densetsu: Hokuto no Ken

tags.name: Martial Arts
tags.description: Centers around the use of traditional hand-to-hand combat.

tags.name: Post-Apocalyptic
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a world or civilization after a global disaster.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Cultivation
tags.description: Features characters using training, often martial arts-related, and other special methods to cultivate qi (a component of traditional Chinese philosophy, described as "life force") and gain strength or immortality.

tags.name: Gangs
tags.description: Centers around gang organizations.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Motorcycles
tags.description: Prominently features the use of motorcycles.

tags.name: Astronomy
tags.description: Relating or centered around the study of celestial objects and phenomena, space, or the universe.

tags.name: Torture
tags.description: The act of deliberately inflicting severe pain or suffering upon another individual or oneself as a punishment or with a specific purpose.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Bar
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a bar.

tags.name: Cannibalism
tags.description: Prominently features the act of consuming another member of the same species as food.

tags.name: Archery
tags.description: Centers around the sport of archery, or prominently features the use of archery in combat.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Desert
tags.description: Prominently features a desert environment.

node.description:
[Official website](http://www.haratetsuo.com/)

After graduating from Hongou Senior High School, he became an assistant to comic book artist Yoshihiro Takahashi. Hara's own professional comic artist career began in 1982 with the publication of his first work, "Mad Fighter". He won the first prize of the 33rd "Fresh Jump" award for "Super Challenger". His Weekly Shonen Jump debut was "Iron Don Quixote". His distinctive art in "Hokuto no Ken" began in 1983; it was his first major work.

__Yoshiyuki Okamura__, also known as **Buronson** (武論尊) or **Sho Fumimura** (史村 翔, Fumimura Shō), is a Japanese manga writer most known by his famous work Hokuto no Ken, known in English as Fist of the North Star.  He graduated from the Japanese Air Force Training School in 1967 and served as an Air Force radar mechanic. In 1969 he discharged from the Japanese Navy and was soon hired by Hiroshi Motomiya as a manga assistant. He started his manga writing career when he wrote the script of Pink Punch: Miyabi in 1972, drawn by Goro Sakai. In 1975 Buronson wrote his first big hit The Doberman Detective, drawn by Shinji Hiramatsu. The famous Hokuto no Ken made its debute as Buronson's greatest hit in 1983, drawn by Tetsuo Hara. In 1989 his story Ourou was released as a manga serialized in Animal Magazine, drawn by Kentarou Miura, and in 1990 a sequel entitled Ourou Den was released by the same manga artist. Buronson also collaborated with the manga artist Ryoichi Ikegami in many works as Strain (manga) , Human (manga) and the famous Sanctuary (manga). Among his other major works are The Phantom Gang, with art by Kaoru Shintani.    Buronson was mainly influenced by movies such as Bruce Lee's, and Mad Max.    The nickname Buronson is a tribute to the American actor Charles Bronson, whose way of growing the mustache was imitated by Yoshiyuki Okamura too.

**[Madhouse Profile](http://www.madhouse.co.jp/special/mhpf/mhpf_no028.html)**

**Inoue Toshiki** is a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.

Nozomi Aoki has worked extensively on Leiji Matsumoto's famous space opera anime series Galaxy Express 999 and also more recently The Galaxy Railways. He also scored the popular 80s fighting anime series Fist of the North Star.
Komodo Band provided the 2nd OP/ED for the 1984 classic Hokuto no Ken.

Crystal King is a Japanese rock and kayōkyoku band. They gained commercial success with their debut single "Daitokai" (大都会?) which sold 1.5 million copies, and are remembered in Japan for their performance of the first theme songs of Fist of the North Star: "Ai o Torimodose!!" and "Yuria... Eien ni".  The band was formed by Musshu Yoshizaki in 1971, who was joined by a second vocalist, Masayuki Tanaka, in 1975. Other musicians to have played with the band include Yamashita Michio on guitar and Nomoto Hidetoshi on bass. They made their major label debut in 1980.   Originally consisting of vocalists Monsieur Yoshisaki (ムッシュ吉崎 Musshu Yoshisaki?) and Masayuki Tanaka, guitarist Michio Yamashita (山下 三智夫 Yamashita Michio?), pianist Kimiharu Namakura (中村 公晴 Nakamura Kimiharu?), keyboardist Hiromi Imakiire (今給黎 博美 Imakiire Hiromi?), drummer Ken Kanefuku (金福 健 Kanefuku Ken?), and bassist Hidetoshi Nomoto (野元 英俊 Nomoto Hidetoshi?), the band broke up in 1995 and beginning in 2004, Yoshisaki began performing as Crystal King as a solo project. Tanaka began his own solo career, severely damaging his voice in 1989. The rest of the band performs as Cross Road (クロスロード Kurosu Rōdo?), reuniting with Tanaka on occasion.

[Wiki (JP)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/芦田豊雄)

Toyoo Ashida was an anime character designer, animation director and director. He is the founder of the anime production studio Studio Live and as well as the Japanese Animation Creators Association (JAniCA) along with [Satoshi Kon](https://anilist.co/staff/99580/).

He is also known under the pseudonyms Yutaka Ekoda (江古田豊) and Monta Ibu (伊武紋太).

Ichirou Itano is a Japanese director, producer, animator and mechanical designer. He has worked in a number of science fiction anime series, especially mecha-themed ones. Director of works such as [Angel Cop](https://anilist.co/anime/1351/), [Battle Royal High School](https://anilist.co/anime/3625/), [Gantz](https://anilist.co/anime/384/) and more.

Itano is best known among anime fans for a style of action scene that he developed, usually nicknamed "Itano Circus" by fans; it refers to a highly stylized and acrobatic method of depicting aerial combat and dogfights in many anime.

The production in [Space Runaway Ideon](https://anilist.co/anime/930/) became a hot topic in the anime industry, and it came to be called this by comparing the brisk movement of mechanics to the air acrobatics of the circus. The technique became more famous when Itano used it for the "dogfights" depicted in [The Super Dimension Fortress Macross](https://anilist.co/anime/1088/) anime TV series in 1982. It's characterized by detailed, fluid shading of the mecha, the close-range acrobatic moves the dueling fighters make in combat, as well as twisting contrails left by fighters and missiles. It is also commonly used in specific reference to an attack where a mecha or spaceship launches a large swarm of guided missiles with meticulously animated spiraling smoke trails and erratic trajectories and its target is repeatedly dodging those missiles at a high speed.

According to him, [Hideaki Anno](https://anilist.co/staff/100111/), [Masami Gotou](https://anilist.co/staff/129865/) and [Yasushi Muraki](https://anilist.co/staff/105090/) are the only animators to have fully mastered Itano Circus.

[Wiki (JP)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/芦田豊雄)

Toyoo Ashida was an anime character designer, animation director and director. He is the founder of the anime production studio Studio Live and as well as the Japanese Animation Creators Association (JAniCA) along with [Satoshi Kon](https://anilist.co/staff/99580/).

He is also known under the pseudonyms Yutaka Ekoda (江古田豊) and Monta Ibu (伊武紋太).

Currently Executive Advisor at [Studio Khara](https://anilist.co/studio/47/Studio-Khara).

After graduating from the Animation Department of Tokyo Designer Gakuin he joned Studio Giants, later working at [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/Gainax) during the production of [Royal Space Force: The Wings of Honneamise](https://anilist.co/anime/1034/Royal-Space-Force-The-Wings-of-Honneamise/).

He became a close collaborator of [Hideaki Anno](https://anilist.co/staff/100111/Hideaki-Anno), occupying high positions in all of his productions.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/影山楙倫)

Originating from Ashi Productions.

Birthplace: Saint-Jean-de-Luz, Basses-Pyrénées, France

Married to [Agnès Gribe](https://anilist.co/staff/96614) and is the father of [Virginie](https://anilist.co/staff/158644) and [Emmanuelle](https://anilist.co/staff/158649)
